page.title: 12THE OLD MILL
page.content:
We visited the old mill. It is at Streetly End. It stands about 40 feet high. There are no sails, and the cap has collapsed. Some of us thought it felt spooky. Here is a poem about it.
The mill ghost. I walked down the path to the disinte_ grating hunk of wood and brick that was once a mill. My mind racing I grabbed the handrail and ran up the stairs. Lonely, quiet.... I shivered as the smell of rotting wood wafted around. I fell asleep, only to be woken by a shuffling. As it came closer I realized it was a ghost! I ran across the unstable bridge, climbed onto the iron, and fell. The wall closed in on me unconcious...
